line_1: At least with care forbidden paths pursue?
line_2: Who quits the road, should keep it still in view:

line_1: Who quits the road, should keep it still in view:
line_2: At least with care forbidden paths pursue?

line_1: From genius some few 'scapes may be allow'd;
line_2: But ever keep within its neighbourhood.

line_1: But ever keep within its neighbourhood.
line_2: From genius some few 'scapes may be allow'd;

line_1: But C—r, faithless to his byass see,
line_2: With giant-sin opposing heav'n's decree.

line_1: With giant-sin opposing heav'n's decree.
line_2: But C—r, faithless to his byass see,

line_1: Still fond where he shou'd not, he blunders on
line_2: With all that haste fools make to be undone:

line_1: With all that haste fools make to be undone:
line_2: Still fond where he shou'd not, he blunders on

line_1: Want of success his passion but augments;
line_2: Like eunuchs rage of love, from impotence.

line_1: Like eunuchs rage of love, from impotence.
line_2: Want of success his passion but augments;

line_1: 'Mongst all the instances of genius crost,
line_2: The rhyming tribe are those who err the most.

line_1: The rhyming tribe are those who err the most.
line_2: 'Mongst all the instances of genius crost,

line_1: Each piddling wretch who hath but common sense,
line_2: Or thinks he hath, to verse shall make pretence:

line_1: Or thinks he hath, to verse shall make pretence:
line_2: Each piddling wretch who hath but common sense,

line_1: Why not? 'tis their diversion, and 'twere hard
line_2: If men of their estates shou'd be debarr'd.

line_1: If men of their estates shou'd be debarr'd.
line_2: Why not? 'tis their diversion, and 'twere hard

line_1: Thus wealth with them gives every thing beside;
line_2: As people worth so much are qualify'd:

line_1: As people worth so much are qualify'd:
line_2: Thus wealth with them gives every thing beside;

line_1: They've all the requisites for writing fit,
line_2: All but that one — some little share of wit.

line_1: All but that one — some little share of wit.
line_2: They've all the requisites for writing fit,

line_1: Give way, ye friends, nor with fond pray'rs proceed
line_2: To stop the progress of a pen full speed.

line_1: To stop the progress of a pen full speed.
line_2: Give way, ye friends, nor with fond pray'rs proceed

line_1: Tis heav'n, incens'd by some prodigious crime,
line_2: Thus for men's sins determines them to rhyme.

line_1: Thus for men's sins determines them to rhyme.
line_2: Tis heav'n, incens'd by some prodigious crime,

line_1: Bad men, no doubt; perhaps 'tis vengeance due
line_2: For shrines they've plunder'd, or some wretch they slew.

line_1: For shrines they've plunder'd, or some wretch they slew.
line_2: Bad men, no doubt; perhaps 'tis vengeance due

line_1: Whate'er it be, sure grievous is th' offence,
line_2: And grievous is (heaven knows!) its recompence.

line_1: And grievous is (heaven knows!) its recompence.
line_2: Whate'er it be, sure grievous is th' offence,

line_1: At once in want of rhyme, and want of rest;
line_2: Plagues to themselves, and to mankind a jest:

line_1: Plagues to themselves, and to mankind a jest:
line_2: At once in want of rhyme, and want of rest;

line_1: Seduc'd by empty forms of false delight —
line_2: Such, in some men, their deadly lust to write!

line_1: Such, in some men, their deadly lust to write!
line_2: Seduc'd by empty forms of false delight —

line_1: Ev'n I, whose genius seems as much forgot,
line_2: (Mine when I write, as your's when you do not;)

line_1: (Mine when I write, as your's when you do not;)
line_2: Ev'n I, whose genius seems as much forgot,

line_1: Who gravely thus can others' faults condemn,
line_2: My self allowing, what I blame in them;

line_1: My self allowing, what I blame in them;
line_2: Who gravely thus can others' faults condemn,

line_1: With no pretence to Phoebus' aid divine,
line_2: Nor the least int'rest in the tuneful Nine,

line_1: Nor the least int'rest in the tuneful Nine,
line_2: With no pretence to Phoebus' aid divine,

line_1: With all the guilt of impotence in view,
line_2: Griev'd for past sins, but yet committing new;

line_1: Griev'd for past sins, but yet committing new;
line_2: With all the guilt of impotence in view,

line_1: Whate'er the wits may say, or wise may think,
line_2: Am fooling ev'ry way with pen and ink.

line_1: Am fooling ev'ry way with pen and ink.
line_2: Whate'er the wits may say, or wise may think,

line_1: When all who wish me best, begin t' advise,
line_2: 'That being witty, is not being wise;

line_1: 'That being witty, is not being wise;
line_2: When all who wish me best, begin t' advise,

line_1: 'That if the voice of int'rest might be heard,
line_2: 'For one who wears a gown, — wou'd be prefer'd —

line_1: 'For one who wears a gown, — wou'd be prefer'd —
line_2: 'That if the voice of int'rest might be heard,

line_1: Incorrigibly deaf, I feign a yawn;
line_2: And mock their just conclusions, ere they're drawn.

line_1: And mock their just conclusions, ere they're drawn.
line_2: Incorrigibly deaf, I feign a yawn;

line_1: If to my practice, they oppos'd my theme;
line_2: And pointed, how I swam against the stream:

line_1: And pointed, how I swam against the stream:
line_2: If to my practice, they oppos'd my theme;

line_1: With all the rancour of a bard in rage,
line_2: I'd quote 'em half the writers of the age;

line_1: I'd quote 'em half the writers of the age;
line_2: With all the rancour of a bard in rage,

line_1: Who in a wrath of verse, with all their might
line_2: Write on, howe'er unqualify'd to write,

line_1: Write on, howe'er unqualify'd to write,
line_2: Who in a wrath of verse, with all their might

line_1: IN this small work, all nature's wonders see,
line_2: The soften'd features of philosophy.

line_1: The soften'd features of philosophy.
line_2: IN this small work, all nature's wonders see,

line_1: In truth by easy steps you here advance,
line_2: Truth is diverting, as the best romance.

line_1: Truth is diverting, as the best romance.
line_2: In truth by easy steps you here advance,

line_1: Long had these arts to sages been confin'd,
line_2: None saw their beauty, till by poring blind;

line_1: None saw their beauty, till by poring blind;
line_2: Long had these arts to sages been confin'd,

line_1: By studying spent, like men that cram too full,
line_2: From Wisdom's feast they rose not chear'd, but dull:

line_1: From Wisdom's feast they rose not chear'd, but dull:
line_2: By studying spent, like men that cram too full,

line_1: The gay and airy smil'd to see 'em grave,
line_2: And fled such wisdom like Trophonius' cave.

line_1: And fled such wisdom like Trophonius' cave.
line_2: The gay and airy smil'd to see 'em grave,

line_1: Justly they thought they might those arts despise,
line_2: Which made men sullen, ere they could be wise.

line_1: Which made men sullen, ere they could be wise.
line_2: Justly they thought they might those arts despise,

line_1: Brought down to sight, with ease you view 'em here;
line_2: Tho' deep the bottom, yet the stream is clear.

line_1: Tho' deep the bottom, yet the stream is clear.
line_2: Brought down to sight, with ease you view 'em here;

line_1: Your flutt'ring sex still valued science less;
line_2: Careless of any but the arts of dress.

line_1: Careless of any but the arts of dress.
line_2: Your flutt'ring sex still valued science less;

line_1: Their useless time was idly thrown away
line_2: On empty novels, or some new-born play;

line_1: On empty novels, or some new-born play;
line_2: Their useless time was idly thrown away

line_1: The best, perhaps, a few loose hours might spare
line_2: For some unmeaning thing, miscall'd a pray'r.

line_1: For some unmeaning thing, miscall'd a pray'r.
line_2: The best, perhaps, a few loose hours might spare

line_1: In vain the glitt'ring orbs, each starry night,
line_2: With mingling blazes shed a flood of light:

line_1: With mingling blazes shed a flood of light:
line_2: In vain the glitt'ring orbs, each starry night,

line_1: Each nymph with cold indiff'rence saw 'em rise;
line_2: And, taught by fops, to them preferr'd her eyes.

line_1: And, taught by fops, to them preferr'd her eyes.
line_2: Each nymph with cold indiff'rence saw 'em rise;

line_1: None thought the stars were suns so widely sown,
line_2: None dreamt of other worlds, besides our own.

line_1: None dreamt of other worlds, besides our own.
line_2: None thought the stars were suns so widely sown,

line_1: Well might they boast their charms, when ev'ry fair
line_2: Thought this world all; and her's the brightest here.

line_1: Thought this world all; and her's the brightest here.
line_2: Well might they boast their charms, when ev'ry fair

line_1: Ah! quit not the large thoughts this book inspires,
line_2: For those thin trifles which your sex admires:

line_1: For those thin trifles which your sex admires:
line_2: Ah! quit not the large thoughts this book inspires,

line_1: Assert your claim to sense, and shew mankind,
line_2: That reason is not to themselves confin'd.

line_1: That reason is not to themselves confin'd.
line_2: Assert your claim to sense, and shew mankind,

line_1: The haughty belle, whose beauty's aweful shrine
line_2: 'Twere sacrilege t' imagine not divine,

line_1: 'Twere sacrilege t' imagine not divine,
line_2: The haughty belle, whose beauty's aweful shrine

line_1: Who thought so greatly of her eyes before,
line_2: Bid her read this, and then be vain no more.

line_1: Bid her read this, and then be vain no more.
line_2: Who thought so greatly of her eyes before,

line_1: How poor ev'n you, who reign without controul,
line_2: If we except the beauties of your soul!

line_1: If we except the beauties of your soul!
line_2: How poor ev'n you, who reign without controul,

line_1: Shou'd all beholders feel the same surprize:
line_2: Shou'd all who see you, see you with my eyes;

line_1: Shou'd all who see you, see you with my eyes;
line_2: Shou'd all beholders feel the same surprize:

line_1: Were no sick blasts to make that beauty less;
line_2: Cou'd you be what I think, what all confess:

line_1: Cou'd you be what I think, what all confess:
line_2: Were no sick blasts to make that beauty less;

line_1: 'Tis but a narrow space those charms engage;
line_2: The island only, and not half an age!

line_1: The island only, and not half an age!
line_2: 'Tis but a narrow space those charms engage;
